Events.html: 334 BC – The Macedonian army of Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia in the Battle of the Granicus.
Events.text: The Macedonian army of Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia in the Battle of the Granicus.

Events.html: 853 – A Byzantine fleet sacks and destroys undefended Damietta in Egypt
Events.text: A Byzantine fleet sacks and destroys undefended Damietta in Egypt

Events.html: 1176 – The Hashshashin (Assassins) attempt to murder Saladin near Aleppo.
Events.text: The Hashshashin (Assassins) attempt to murder Saladin near Aleppo.

Events.html: 1200 – King John of England and King Philip II of France sign the Treaty of Le Goulet.
Events.text: King John of England and King Philip II of France sign the Treaty of Le Goulet.

Events.html: 1246 – Henry Raspe is elected anti-king of the Kingdom of Germany, in opposition to Conrad IV.
Events.text: Henry Raspe is elected anti-king of the Kingdom of Germany, in opposition to Conrad IV.

Events.html: 1254 – Serbian King Stephen Uroš I and the Republic of Venice sign a peace treaty.
Events.text: Serbian King Stephen Uroš I and the Republic of Venice sign a peace treaty.

Events.html: 1377 – Pope Gregory XI issues five papal bulls to denounce the doctrines of English theologian John Wycliffe.
Events.text: Pope Gregory XI issues five papal bulls to denounce the doctrines of English theologian John Wycliffe.

Events.html: 1455 – Start of the Wars of the Roses: at the First Battle of St Albans, Richard, Duke of York, defeats and captures King Henry VI of England.
Events.text: Start of the Wars of the Roses: at the First Battle of St Albans, Richard, Duke of York, defeats and captures King Henry VI of England.

links.subject: Richard, Duke of York
links.title: Richard of York, 3rd Duke of York

Events.html: 1629 – Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II and Danish King Christian IV sign the Treaty of Lübeck to end the Danish intervention in the Thirty Years' War.
Events.text: Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II and Danish King Christian IV sign the Treaty of Lübeck to end the Danish intervention in the Thirty Years' War.

Events.html: 1762 – Sweden and Prussia sign the Treaty of Hamburg.
Events.text: Sweden and Prussia sign the Treaty of Hamburg.

Events.html: 1807 – A grand jury indicts former Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr on a charge of treason.
Events.text: A grand jury indicts former Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr on a charge of treason.

links.subject: Vice President of the United States
links.title: Vice President of the United States

Events.html: 1807 – Most of the English town of Chudleigh is destroyed by fire.
Events.text: Most of the English town of Chudleigh is destroyed by fire.

Events.html: 1809 – On the second and last day of the Battle of Aspern-Essling (near Vienna, Austria), Napoleon I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.
Events.text: On the second and last day of the Battle of Aspern-Essling (near Vienna, Austria), Napoleon I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.

Events.html: 1816 – A mob in Littleport, Cambridgeshire, England, riots over high unemployment and rising grain costs; the rioting spreads to Ely the next day.
Events.text: A mob in Littleport, Cambridgeshire, England, riots over high unemployment and rising grain costs; the rioting spreads to Ely the next day.

Events.html: 1819 – The SS Savannah leaves port at Savannah, Georgia, United States, on a voyage to become the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean. The ship arrived at Liverpool, England, on June 20.
Events.text: The SS Savannah leaves port at Savannah, Georgia, United States, on a voyage to become the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean. The ship arrived at Liverpool, England, on June 20.

Events.html: 1826 – HMS Beagle departs on its first voyage.
Events.text: HMS Beagle departs on its first voyage.

Events.html: 1840 – The transportation of British convicts to the New South Wales colony is abolished.
Events.text: The transportation of British convicts to the New South Wales colony is abolished.

Events.html: 1848 – Slavery is abolished in Martinique.
Events.text: Slavery is abolished in Martinique.

Events.html: 1849 – Future U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is issued a patent for an invention to lift boats over obstacles in a river, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.
Events.text: Future U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is issued a patent for an invention to lift boats over obstacles in a river, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.

Events.html: 1856 – Congressman Preston Brooks of South Carolina beats Senator Charles Sumner with a cane in the hall of the United States Senate for a speech Sumner had made attacking Southerners who sympathized with the pro-slavery violence in Kansas ("Bleeding Kansas").
Events.text: Congressman Preston Brooks of South Carolina beats Senator Charles Sumner with a cane in the hall of the United States Senate for a speech Sumner had made attacking Southerners who sympathized with the pro-slavery violence in Kansas ("Bleeding Kansas").

Events.html: 1863 – American Civil War: Siege of Port Hudson – Union forces begin to lay siege to the Confederate-controlled Port Hudson, Louisiana.
Events.text: American Civil War: Siege of Port Hudson – Union forces begin to lay siege to the Confederate-controlled Port Hudson, Louisiana.

Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: After ten weeks, the Union Army's Red River Campaign ends with the Union unable to achieve any of its objectives.
Events.text: American Civil War: After ten weeks, the Union Army's Red River Campaign ends with the Union unable to achieve any of its objectives.

Events.html: 1871 – The U.S. Army issues an order for abandonment of Fort Kearny in Nebraska.
Events.text: The U.S. Army issues an order for abandonment of Fort Kearny in Nebraska.

Events.html: 1872 – Reconstruction: U.S. President Ulysses S. Grant signs the Amnesty Act into law restoring full civil and political rights to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.
Events.text: Reconstruction: U.S. President Ulysses S. Grant signs the Amnesty Act into law restoring full civil and political rights to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.

Events.html: 1885 – Prior to burial in the Panthéon, the body of Victor Hugo was exposed under the Arc de Triomphe during the night.
Events.text: Prior to burial in the Panthéon, the body of Victor Hugo was exposed under the Arc de Triomphe during the night.

Events.html: 1897 – The Blackwall Tunnel under the River Thames is officially opened
Events.text: The Blackwall Tunnel under the River Thames is officially opened

Events.html: 1903 – Launch of the White Star Liner, SS Ionic.
Events.text: Launch of the White Star Liner, SS Ionic.

Events.html: 1906 – The Wright brothers are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "Flying-Machine".
Events.text: The Wright brothers are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "Flying-Machine".

Events.html: 1915 – Lassen Peak erupts with a powerful force, and is the only mountain other than Mount St. Helens to erupt in the contiguous US during the 20th century.
Events.text: Lassen Peak erupts with a powerful force, and is the only mountain other than Mount St. Helens to erupt in the contiguous US during the 20th century.

Events.html: 1915 – Three trains collide in the Quintinshill rail disaster near Gretna Green, Scotland, killing 227 people and injuring 246; the accident is found to be the result of non-standard operating practices during a shift change at a busy junction.
Events.text: Three trains collide in the Quintinshill rail disaster near Gretna Green, Scotland, killing 227 people and injuring 246; the accident is found to be the result of non-standard operating practices during a shift change at a busy junction.

Events.html: 1926 – Chiang Kai-shek replaces communists in Kuomintang, China.
Events.text: Chiang Kai-shek replaces communists in Kuomintang, China.

Events.html: 1939 – World War II: Germany and Italy sign the Pact of Steel.
Events.text: World War II: Germany and Italy sign the Pact of Steel.

Events.html: 1942 – Mexico enters World War II on the side of the Allies.
Events.text: Mexico enters World War II on the side of the Allies.

Events.html: 1942 – The Steel Workers Organizing Committee disbands, and a new trade union, the United Steelworkers, is formed.
Events.text: The Steel Workers Organizing Committee disbands, and a new trade union, the United Steelworkers, is formed.

Events.html: 1942 – World War II: Ted Williams of the Boston Red Sox enlists in the United States Marine Corps as a flight instructor.
Events.text: World War II: Ted Williams of the Boston Red Sox enlists in the United States Marine Corps as a flight instructor.

Events.html: 1943 – Joseph Stalin disbands Comintern.
Events.text: Joseph Stalin disbands Comintern.

Events.html: 1945 – Operation Paperclip – United States Army Major Robert B. Staver recommends that the U.S. evacuate German scientists and engineers to help in the development of rocket technology.
Events.text: Operation Paperclip – United States Army Major Robert B. Staver recommends that the U.S. evacuate German scientists and engineers to help in the development of rocket technology.

Events.html: 1947 – Cold War: in an effort to fight the spread of Communism, the U.S. President Harry S. Truman signs an act into law that will later be called the Truman Doctrine. The act grants $400 million in military and economic aid to Turkey and Greece, each battling an internal Communist movement.
Events.text: Cold War: in an effort to fight the spread of Communism, the U.S. President Harry S. Truman signs an act into law that will later be called the Truman Doctrine. The act grants $400 million in military and economic aid to Turkey and Greece, each battling an internal Communist movement.

Events.html: 1958 – Sri Lankan riots of 1958: This riot is a watershed event in the race relationship of the various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total number of deaths is estimated to be 300, mostly Sri Lankan Tamils.
Events.text: Sri Lankan riots of 1958: This riot is a watershed event in the race relationship of the various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total number of deaths is estimated to be 300, mostly Sri Lankan Tamils.

Events.html: 1960 – An earthquake measuring 9.5 on the moment magnitude scale, now known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, hits southern Chile. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.
Events.text: An earthquake measuring 9.5 on the moment magnitude scale, now known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, hits southern Chile. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.

Events.html: 1961 – An earthquake rocks New South Wales.
Events.text: An earthquake rocks New South Wales.

Events.html: 1962 – Continental Airlines Flight 11 crashes after bombs explode on board.
Events.text: Continental Airlines Flight 11 crashes after bombs explode on board.

Events.html: 1963 – An assassination attempt of Greek left-wing politician Grigoris Lambrakis, who will die five days later.
Events.text: An assassination attempt of Greek left-wing politician Grigoris Lambrakis, who will die five days later.

Events.html: 1964 – The U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson announces the goals of his Great Society social reforms to bring an "end to poverty and racial injustice" in America.
Events.text: The U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson announces the goals of his Great Society social reforms to bring an "end to poverty and racial injustice" in America.

Events.html: 1967 – The L'Innovation department store in the center of Brussels, Belgium, burns down. It is the most devastating fire in Belgian history, resulting in 323 dead and missing and 150 injured.
Events.text: The L'Innovation department store in the center of Brussels, Belgium, burns down. It is the most devastating fire in Belgian history, resulting in 323 dead and missing and 150 injured.

Events.html: 1967 – Vietnam War: Vinh Xuan massacre.
Events.text: Vietnam War: Vinh Xuan massacre.

Events.html: 1968 – The nuclear-powered submarine the USS Scorpion sinks with 99 men aboard 400 miles southwest of the Azores.
Events.text: The nuclear-powered submarine the USS Scorpion sinks with 99 men aboard 400 miles southwest of the Azores.

Events.html: 1969 – Apollo 10 's lunar module flies within 8.4 nautical miles (16 km) of the moon's surface.
Events.text: Apollo 10 's lunar module flies within 8.4 nautical miles (16 km) of the moon's surface.

Events.html: 1972 – Ceylon adopts a new constitution, thus becoming a Republic, changes its name to Sri Lanka, and joins the Commonwealth of Nations.
Events.text: Ceylon adopts a new constitution, thus becoming a Republic, changes its name to Sri Lanka, and joins the Commonwealth of Nations.

Events.html: 1980 – Namco releases the highly influential arcade game Pac-Man.
Events.text: Namco releases the highly influential arcade game Pac-Man.

Events.html: 1987 – Hashimpura massacre in Meerut, India.
Events.text: Hashimpura massacre in Meerut, India.

Events.html: 1987 – First ever Rugby World Cup kicks off with New Zealand playing Italy at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand.
Events.text: First ever Rugby World Cup kicks off with New Zealand playing Italy at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand.

Events.html: 1990 – North and South Yemen are unified to create the Republic of Yemen.
Events.text: North and South Yemen are unified to create the Republic of Yemen.

Events.html: 1990 – Microsoft releases the Windows 3.0 operating system.
Events.text: Microsoft releases the Windows 3.0 operating system.

Events.html: 1992 – After 30 years, 66-year-old Johnny Carson hosts The Tonight Show for the last time.
Events.text: After 30 years, 66-year-old Johnny Carson hosts The Tonight Show for the last time.

links.subject: The Tonight Show
links.title: The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson

Events.html: 1992 – Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Slovenia join the United Nations.
Events.text: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Slovenia join the United Nations.

Events.html: 1997 – Kelly Flinn, the US Air Force's first female bomber pilot certified for combat, accepts a general discharge in order to avoid a court-martial.
Events.text: Kelly Flinn, the US Air Force's first female bomber pilot certified for combat, accepts a general discharge in order to avoid a court-martial.

Events.html: 1998 – Lewinsky scandal: a federal judge rules that United States Secret Service agents can be compelled to testify before a grand jury concerning the scandal, involving President Bill Clinton.
Events.text: Lewinsky scandal: a federal judge rules that United States Secret Service agents can be compelled to testify before a grand jury concerning the scandal, involving President Bill Clinton.

Events.html: 2002 – In Washington, D.C., the remains of the missing Chandra Levy are found in Rock Creek Park.
Events.text: In Washington, D.C., the remains of the missing Chandra Levy are found in Rock Creek Park.

Events.html: 2002 – American civil rights movement: a jury in Birmingham, Alabama, convicts former Ku Klux Klan member Bobby Frank Cherry of the 1963 murders of four girls in the bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church.
Events.text: American civil rights movement: a jury in Birmingham, Alabama, convicts former Ku Klux Klan member Bobby Frank Cherry of the 1963 murders of four girls in the bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church.

links.subject: bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church
links.title: 16th Street Baptist Church bombing

Events.html: 2003 – In Fort Worth, Texas, Annika Sörenstam becomes the first woman to play the PGA Tour in 58 years.
Events.text: In Fort Worth, Texas, Annika Sörenstam becomes the first woman to play the PGA Tour in 58 years.

Events.html: 2004 – The U.S. town of Hallam, Nebraska is wiped out by a powerful F4 tornado (part of the May 2004 tornado outbreak sequence) which kills one resident, and becomes the widest tornado on record at 2.5 miles (4.0 km) wide; a record that wouldn't be broken until a the El Reno tornado on May 31, 2013.
Events.text: The U.S. town of Hallam, Nebraska is wiped out by a powerful F4 tornado (part of the May 2004 tornado outbreak sequence) which kills one resident, and becomes the widest tornado on record at 2.5 miles (4.0 km) wide; a record that wouldn't be broken until a the El Reno tornado on May 31, 2013.

Events.html: 2008 – The Late-May 2008 tornado outbreak sequence unleashes 235 tornadoes, including an EF4 and an EF5 tornado, between May 22 and May 31, 2008. The tornadoes strike 19 states and one Canadian province.
Events.text: The Late-May 2008 tornado outbreak sequence unleashes 235 tornadoes, including an EF4 and an EF5 tornado, between May 22 and May 31, 2008. The tornadoes strike 19 states and one Canadian province.

Events.html: 2010 – An Air India Express Boeing 737 goes over a cliff and crashes upon landing at Mangalore, India, killing 158 of the 166 people on board. It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.
Events.text: An Air India Express Boeing 737 goes over a cliff and crashes upon landing at Mangalore, India, killing 158 of the 166 people on board. It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.

links.subject: goes over a cliff and crashes
links.title: Air India Express Flight 812

Events.html: 2011 – An EF5 tornado strikes Joplin, Missouri, killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion worth in damage—the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.
Events.text: An EF5 tornado strikes Joplin, Missouri, killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion worth in damage—the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.

Events.html: 2012 – Tokyo Skytree is opened to public. It is the tallest tower in world (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m).
Events.text: Tokyo Skytree is opened to public. It is the tallest tower in world (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m).

links.subject: tallest tower in world
links.title: List of tallest towers in the world

Events.html: 2014 – General Prayuth Chan-ocha of the Royal Thai Armed Forces announces a military coup d'état, following six months of political turmoil.
Events.text: General Prayuth Chan-ocha of the Royal Thai Armed Forces announces a military coup d'état, following six months of political turmoil.

Events.html: 2014 – An explosion occurs in the city of Ürümqi, the capital of China's far-western Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, resulting in at least 43 deaths and 91 injuries.
Events.text: An explosion occurs in the city of Ürümqi, the capital of China's far-western Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, resulting in at least 43 deaths and 91 injuries.
